question_title: What will be the value of "Market Yield on U.S. Treasury Securities at 7-Year Constant Maturity, Quoted on an Investment Basis" on 2026-02-10?
summary: The 7-year Treasury yield (DGS7) stood at 4.01% on Jan 30, 2026, with a tight 4-bp range over the preceding week. With only 7 trading days to resolution and typical daily volatility of ~5 bps, the yield is unlikely to move substantially. Kevin Warsh's nomination as Fed Chair introduces a slight hawkish bias, but markets remain calm with two Fed rate cuts still priced for 2026. Monte Carlo simulation with fat tails (Student-t distribution) centers the forecast at ~4.01% with an 80% confidence interval of 3.85% to 4.18%.

factors.description: Current yield at 4.01% with very stable recent trading (4.01-4.05% range over 5 days) - strong anchor for short-term forecast
Kevin Warsh nominated as Fed Chair - markets view as hawkish, could put modest upward pressure on yields
Fed at 3.50-3.75% with markets pricing 2 more cuts in 2026 - supportive of current yield levels
Short 7-day horizon limits potential for large moves absent major surprise
Jobs report and other data could create short-term volatility in either direction
